data.title: Added Iterable<Geometry> support for GeometryList
data.body:
so it can be used with foreach statements.
It might be not a best practice to create iterator each frame, but it saves few lines when quickly prototyping things - and in any case, iterator cost is quite small and should never leave new generation.

data.title: PhysicsSpace setGravity() (jME3-bullet.jar)
SphereCollisionShape setScale() warning (jME3-bullet.jar)
data.body:
The constructor calls createShape() and this one calls setScale() which shows an annoying warning each time a SphereCollisionShape is instanced.

I would suggest to remove the call to setScale() in the createShape() method.

data.title: Nifty Editor integration
data.body:
Hello, this pull request adds the new visual editor for nifty-gui files. This is the result of the JME Soc project, also there is a detailed devblog about the implementation in (this)[http://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/forum/board/development/summer-of-code/] sub forum. In particular this pull requests contains new features such as : 
- A new palette
- New visual editor with real time manipulation of elements
- Templates for : A basic nifty-gui, an empty nifty-gui , empty style , control and button style.
- Navigator to see the gui structure
- Undo support
- Copy&Paste actions
- Save changes

The project contains all the classes needed to integrate the editor in SDK platform all the logic to edit nifty files resides inside nifty-editor project which this project depends.
I hope this is details is enough!

data.title: added a pre-order traversal of the scene graph.
data.body: Adds a new method called depthLastTraversal() to Spatial and subclasses as an extension to depthFirstTraversal() and breathFirstTraversal().

data.title: Serializer has an unused line
data.body:
The variable created in line 205
`SerializerRegistration reg = new SerializerRegistration(serializer, cls, classId);`
 of com.jme3.network.serializing.Serializer is never used and the instantiation itself also doesn't do anything.

As a sidenote, the whole Serializer is a bit intransparent because of the chained `return otherMethod(args);` and i think in turn there is some more stuff that is never used.

data.title: jbullet: refactor PhysiscSpace.addAll/removeAll
data.body:
- only add joint if current PhysicNode is BodyA of the joint
  - => avoid logging warning
  - => fix a previous bug in test about getBodyA when adding/removing BodyB
- remove optimisation that by-pass routing made by add()/remove()

data.title: Specify return type of AbstractControl#cloneForSpatial
Highlight filter
data.body:
This Pull Request adds a post processing filter that highlights objects in the scene.
The objects are highlighted by drawing a border around them.
The functionallity is simmilar to the glow effect. The scene is rendered using a specific 'Highlight' technique that is added to Lighting.j3md and Unshaded.j3md that renders only these objects that have to material property 'Highlighted' set to true.
In a post process, the shape edges are then extracted and drawn on the screen.
The edge color and thickness are customable.

Other highlighting effects, such as drawing the object with flipped culling again, suffer from the fact that the outline may not be drawn complete. This issue is solved by this method. However, because the scene is rendered twice and the edges have to be detected, the performance decreases. If the edge thickness is very hight, this might be a problem.

The highlight filter also does not work when mutlisampling is enabled, for some unknown reason.

Here are some screenshots from the test case:
![nohighlight](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1770337/3787952/767a6f32-1a45-11e4-8c86-965b27aae992.jpg)
![highlight](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1770337/3787953/7c4bd324-1a45-11e4-8ee2-438f0ed90680.jpg)

data.title: Extended dds support in the JME-SDK
data.body: The engine can load dds textures, but the SDK cannot display, open and edit them. However, I think that the dds texture format is one of the most important formats for textures, because it can be directly loaded into the GPU memory. Therefore, I've added support for these textures in the sdk. These code changes come in four steps: 1. Relax restrictions in the dds loader in the core engine 2. Add libraries to load and store dds textures for the SDK 3. Extend the module Texture-Editor 4. Add a dialog that can convert textures 1. Relax restrictions in the dds loader The dds loader tests if the flag "DDSCAPS_TEXTURE" is set. However, there exists many vaild textures without these flags (valid because they can be loaded by the official dds loader). Especially the libraries in the next step create textures without that flag. diff --git a/jme3-core/src/plugins/java/com/jme3/texture/plugins/DDSLoader.java b/jme3-core/src/plugins/java/com/jme3/texture/plugins/DDSLoader.java index 8ea46a7..8aa6749 100644 --- a/jme3-core/src/plugins/java/com/jme3/texture/plugins/DDSLoader.java +++ b/jme3-core/src/plugins/java/com/jme3/texture/plugins/DDSLoader.java @@ -203,9 +203,10 @@ public class DDSLoader implements AssetLoader { texture3D = false; ``` if (!directx10) { ``` - if (!is(caps1, DDSCAPS_TEXTURE)) { - throw new IOException("File is not a texture"); - } - ``` //ignore it, there exists many valid textures that have not this flag set ``` +// if (!is(caps1, DDSCAPS_TEXTURE)) { +// throw new IOException("File is not a texture"); +// } ``` if (depth <= 0) { depth = 1; ``` 2. Add libraries to load and store dds textures for the SDK I use the library https://code.google.com/p/java-dds/ for reading and https://github.com/Dahie/DDS-Utils for writing. These libraries are a bit old and buggy, but the best I could find. 3. Extend the module Texture-Editor In this main step, the texture editor is extended, so that dds textures are recognized as textures and can be read and written. 4. Add a dialog that can convert textures The last step is an addon that allows to convert textures to a different format and also allows to compress the dds textures. The SDK already support the texture compression tool, but it requires the tool from NVIDIA to be installed. This dialog has limited functionallity, but it does not need additional executables. It is also directly integrated into the node structure. This dialog looks like: ![dds-converter](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1770337/3776475/0f371334-1955-11e4-9d29-dc38ff393289.jpg)

data.title: Android application gets not shutdown completely
data.body:
When quiting the activity trough the dialog the application gets not shutdown completely. As it seems it is still holding a lock on some file, and then the following restart fails with a 

```
com.jme3.asset.AssetNotFoundException: Interface/Fonts/Default.fnt
            at com.jme3.asset.DesktopAssetManager.loadAsset(DesktopAssetManager.java:283)
            at com.jme3.asset.DesktopAssetManager.loadFont(DesktopAssetManager.java:370)
            at com.jme3.app.SimpleApplication.loadGuiFont(SimpleApplication.java:179)
            at com.jme3.app.SimpleApplication.initialize(SimpleApplication.java:187)
            at com.jme3.app.AndroidHarness.initialize(AndroidHarness.java:455)
            at com.jme3.system.android.OGLESContext.initInThread(OGLESContext.java:229)
            at com.jme3.system.android.OGLESContext.onSurfaceCreated(OGLESContext.java:205)
            at android.opengl.GLSurfaceView$GLThread.guardedRun(GLSurfaceView.java:1503)
            at android.opengl.GLSurfaceView$GLThread.run(GLSurfaceView.java:1242)
```

A possible solution is to override the onDestroy() method with following code:

```
    @Override
    public void onDestroy() {
        super.onDestroy();
        System.runFinalization();
        android.os.Process.killProcess(android.os.Process.myPid());
    }
```

I guess the last two commands could also be added to the AndroidHarness.java and trough that fixing the issue for all users.

data.title: Error dialog being displayed in a headless context
data.body:
This was causing an infinite cycle of java.awt.HeadlessException in case handleError was called in an environment without display.

In applications with a headless context, the error dialog will now be skipped.

data.title: Speedup for TangengBinormalGenerator
data.body:
Parallel version of generate can speed up generation according to number of cores in best case.
processTriangle now uses temp vars instead of allocation, which gives around 30% speedup in Sponza testcase I was running. Entire methods seems modified, but this is because of indent change - actual modification is just few lines at the start and tmp.release at the end.

data.title: SDK: fix #152 SceneComposer/SceneViewer bug in open/close Scene
data.body: The less intrusive fix, it introduce a better symmetrie between open/close scene . A better fix require a "refactor" in the way to chain actions between job/AWT/jME thread => discussion before.

data.title: SDK: SceneComposer/SceneViewer bug in open/close Scene
data.body:
Steps:
1. open or create a scene
2. do some modification, eg new node, move it
3. open or create an other scene
=> the scene is displayed on SceneViewer
4. reply yes to dialogbox asking for saving change in previous scene
=> the sceneviewer display the previous scene
=> the scenecomposer is no longer connected to the active scene,
=> the sceneexplorer seems to react correctly to selection change
=> the sceneviewer display the correct scene if you try to (re)open a scene, but doesn't display the selected node (from sceneexplorer)

try to move, rotate any object, to change selected, to open a new scene. The Scene edition is broken and useless, need to restart.

The bug is not reproductible 100% (multi-thread related) and currently I only have it on master (not on stable 3.0.9).

Result of my investigation : 
The cause is somewhere in the spaghetti in open/close x EDT, Application Queue,... thread. It seems the following action are appends on SceneComposer : 
open/open/close/close, so the SceneComposer is no longer in a correct state, and correct registration.

It's a case where Future and CompletableFuture/Promise (from jdk8) are usefull. I can investigate more and maybe provide PR ?
